intro: Bupleurum canescens, commonly known as the rough valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems that are covered in fine, grayish-white hairs. The plant features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Bupleurum canescens is often found in dry meadows, rocky soils, and along woodland edges, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
